title: 110_hr5523
content: The "Internet Gambling Regulation and Tax Enforcement Act of 2008" establishes a license fee on internet gambling operators. This Act also amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Internet Gambling Regulation and Tax Enforcement Act of 2008 requires licensed internet gambling operators to pay a 2 percent license fee on all funds deposited into betting accounts each month. The fees collected are deposited into the Treasury's general fund as revenue. The Internet Gambling Regulation and Tax Enforcement Act of 2008 mandates that Internet gambling operators pay a 2 percent license fee on deposited funds, which is not considered a deposit. The fees collected are deposited into the Treasury's general fund as revenue and are the exclusive obligation of the operator. The Director, as defined by section 5382 of title 31, is responsible for overseeing this process, and the fee may be treated as an excise tax for administrative purposes. The Internet Gambling Regulation and Tax Enforcement Act of 2008 mandates a 2 percent license fee on deposited funds for Internet gambling operators. The Director, defined by section 5382 of title 31, oversees this process, and the fee may be treated as an excise tax for administrative purposes. "SEC. 6039J. RETURNS OF INTERNET GAMBLING OPERATORS." Every Internet gambling operator subject to section 4491 must provide required information to the Secretary, including the operator's details and those of individuals placing wagers. Records must also be maintained as per regulations. The subsection describes information required by the Secretary for Internet gambling operators, including names, addresses, tax information numbers, gross winnings, wagers, losses, tax withheld, account balances, and transaction details for each person. The subsection outlines the required information for Internet gambling operators, including account balances, deposits, and withdrawals for each person. Operators must provide a written statement to individuals by January 31 of the following year. The subsection specifies the information needed for Internet gambling operators regarding account balances, deposits, and withdrawals for each individual. A written statement must be given to individuals by January 31 of the following year. The table of sections for internet gambling operators is amended to include new item Sec. 6039J. The amendments apply to wagers made after December 31, 2008. The amendments to section 3402(q) include withholding on net internet gambling winnings over $5,000 in a calendar year and no exemption for certain winnings. Definitions are also provided for "proceeds of net internet gambling winnings." The amendments to section 3402(q) include withholding on net internet gambling winnings over $5,000 in a calendar year and no exemption for certain winnings. Definitions are provided for "proceeds of net internet gambling winnings," which refer to amounts withdrawn from an account established for internet gambling. Net internet gambling winnings are defined as gross winnings from internet wagers minus the amount wagered. The amendment defines 'net Internet gambling winnings' as gross winnings from Internet wagers minus the amount wagered. It also includes provisions for backup withholding on these winnings. The amendment applies backup withholding to net Internet gambling winnings, treating the operator as the payor and the person placing the wager as the payee. Effective after December 31, 2008. SEC. 4. WITHHOLDING OF TAX ON NONRESIDENT ALIENS. Tax on Nonresident Alien Individuals is amended to include net Internet gambling income. An exemption for certain gambling winnings now includes wagers placed over the Internet. Withholding of tax on nonresident aliens is amended to include gains on transfers. The amendment includes withholding tax on nonresident aliens for net Internet gambling winnings over $5,000 in a calendar year, effective for wagers placed after December 31, 2008. Tax on wagers is imposed on individuals placing bets with unlicensed operators, effective for wagers made after December 31, 2008, within the United States or its territories by US citizens or residents.
